meanings.definition: Melanoblasts: Immature cells that give rise to melanocytes.
meanings.sent1: The melanoblasts in the skin are like tiny builders creating melanocytes.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study melanoblasts to understand how they develop into melanocytes.
meanings.sent3: The melanoblasts had a meeting to discuss their future as melanocytes.
meanings.sent4: The potential of melanoblasts to transform into melanocytes is like a caterpillar turning into a butterfly.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the melanoblasts look like little seeds waiting to grow into melanocytes.

meanings.definition: Melanoblasts: Cells responsible for producing melanin.
meanings.sent1: Melanoblasts work hard to create melanin for skin protection.
meanings.sent2: The melanoblasts in the body produce melanin to shield against UV rays.
meanings.sent3: The melanoblasts threw a party after successfully making melanin.
meanings.sent4: The melanoblasts are like tiny factories churning out melanin non-stop.
meanings.sent5: The role of melanoblasts in producing melanin is crucial for skin health.

meanings.definition: Melanoblasts: Cells found in the basal layer of the epidermis.
meanings.sent1: In the epidermis, melanoblasts reside in the basal layer for protection.
meanings.sent2: Dermatologists study the behavior of melanoblasts in the basal layer.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous melanoblasts played hide-and-seek in the basal layer.
meanings.sent4: Melanoblasts in the basal layer are like guardians safeguarding the skin.
meanings.sent5: The presence of melanoblasts in the basal layer ensures skin pigmentation.
